materials.raw_text: C: 24 g, Nb: 12 g, Pa: 36 g, Sn: 48 g

sourcing.instructions: C: Graphite powder from a chemical supply store. Nb: Niobium metal powder from a specialty metals supplier. Pa: Protactinium oxide from a nuclear materials supplier (ensure proper handling). Sn: Tin metal powder from an online chemical retailer.
steps: C: Graphite powder from a chemical supply store. Nb: Niobium metal powder from a specialty metals supplier. Pa: Protactinium oxide from a nuclear materials supplier (ensure proper handling). Sn: Tin metal powder from an online chemical retailer.

1. Weigh out 24 g of graphite powder. 2. Weigh 12 g of niobium metal powder. 3. Measure 36 g of protactinium oxide. 4. Weigh 48 g of tin metal powder. 5. Combine all ingredients in a clean, dry mixing container. 6. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders to achieve a uniform blend.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 24 g of graphite powder. 2. Weigh 12 g of niobium metal powder. 3. Measure 36 g of protactinium oxide. 4. Weigh 48 g of tin metal powder. 5. Combine all ingredients in a clean, dry mixing container. 6. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders to achieve a uniform blend.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a high-temperature crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace preheated to 1200°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure full melting and mixing of components.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a high-temperature crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace preheated to 1200°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure full melting and mixing of components.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool gradually to room temperature. 2. This cooling process should take approximately 6-8 hours to prevent thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool gradually to room temperature. 2. This cooling process should take approximately 6-8 hours to prevent thermal shock.

steps: 1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth any rough edges or surfaces. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance surface protection. 4. Allow the sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth any rough edges or surfaces. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance surface protection. 4. Allow the sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling.
